org.fluidity.composition

Interface OpenContainer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentContainer
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MutableContainer, ObservedContainer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    EmptyComponentContainer

    public interface OpenContainer
extends ComponentContainer
    The external API of a fully populated dependency injection container that that allows dynamic component lookup.

    Usage

    The examples below assume the following enclosing boilerplate: 
     @Component
 public final class MyComponent {

   private final ComponentContainer container;

   MyComponent(final ComponentContainer container) {
     this.container = container;
     …
   }

   private void myMethod() {
     … example code snippet from below …
   }
 }

    Component Lookup

     final SomeComponent component = container.getComponent(SomeComponent.class);
 …

    Component Group Lookup

     final SomeGroup[] group = container.getComponentGroup(SomeGroup.class);
 …

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.fluidity.composition.ComponentContainer

        ComponentContainer.BindingException, ComponentContainer.Bindings, ComponentContainer.CircularReferencesException, ComponentContainer.InjectionException, ComponentContainer.InstantiationException, ComponentContainer.Observer, ComponentContainer.ObserverSupport, ComponentContainer.Registry, ComponentContainer.ResolutionException

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Looks up by interface or (super)class and returns a component.
      <T> T[] getComponentGroup(Class<T> api)
      Looks up by interface or (super)class and returns the list of components implementing the given interface, provided that they each, or the given interface itself, has been marked with the @ComponentGroup annotation.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.fluidity.composition.ComponentContainer

        complete, initialize, instantiate, intercepting, invoke, makeChildContainer, makeDomainContainer, observed

    • Method Detail

      • getComponent

        <T> T getComponent(Class<T> api)
            throws ComponentContainer.ResolutionException
        Looks up by interface or (super)class and returns a component. This method is provided for boundary objects (objects created outside the container by third party tools) to acquire their dependencies. If there was no explicit binding to the provided class, no component is returned.

        Note: This method does not allow modification of the component context at the point of invocation so rather than reaching into the container with this method, a better way is to call ComponentContainer.instantiate(Class, ComponentContainer.Bindings...) to gain access to components in this container.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the component type to return.
        Parameters:
        api - a class object that was used to bind a component to; never null.
        Returns:
        the component bound to the give class or null when none was found.
        Throws:
        ResolutionException - when dependency resolution fails.
        ComponentContainer.ResolutionException

      • getComponentGroup

        <T> T[] getComponentGroup(Class<T> api)
        Looks up by interface or (super)class and returns the list of components implementing the given interface, provided that they each, or the given interface itself, has been marked with the @ComponentGroup annotation. This method is provided for boundary objects (objects created outside the container by third party tools) to acquire their dependencies. If there was no explicit binding to the provided class, no component is returned.

        Note: This method does not allow modification of the component context at the point of invocation so rather than reaching into the container with this method, a better way is to call ComponentContainer.instantiate(Class, ComponentContainer.Bindings...) to gain access to components in this container.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the component group type to return.
        Parameters:
        api - the group interface class.
        Returns:
        an array of components that belong to the given group, or null when there is no such group.
